com.docker.domain.game

Class AbstractGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
      • com.docker.domain.game.AbstractGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CareerGame, InfiniteGame, QuickGame

    public abstract class AbstractGame
extends com.badlogic.gdx.ScreenAdapter
    Author:
    HAL9000 Abstraction for all Game classes. Encompasses all functions and attributes which are shared by all Game Modes.

    • Method Detail

      • touchDownEvent

        public boolean touchDownEvent(int x,
                     int y,
                     int pointer,
                     int button)
        This method gets called on any unhandled touchDown Event on the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-Position of the touch event
        y - the y-Position of the touch event
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        button - the button, if one was pressed
        Returns:
        whether the input was processed

      • touchDraggedEvent

        y - the y-Position of the touch event

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns:
        whether the game is over (regardless of whether the player has lost or won the game)

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver(boolean gameOver)
        Note that the game will not be finished immediately if gameOver is set to true. The player shouldn't be able to execute any more actions though. The endscreen will be displayed after all animations (sinking, breaking) are finished.
        Parameters:
        gameOver - whether the game is over (regardless of whether the player has lost or won the game)

      • getStage

        public WorldStage getStage()
        Returns:
        the stage used by the game, containing all actors.

      • setStage

        public void setStage(WorldStage stage)
        Sets the stage used by the game. Note that if you set a new stage, the old one will be discarded, including all its actors.
        Parameters:
        stage - the stage used by the game

      • getViewport

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.viewport.ExtendViewport getViewport()
        Returns:
        the viewport used by the stage.

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.viewport.ExtendViewport viewport)
        Sets the current viewport and applies it to the stage as well.
        Parameters:
        viewport - the viewport used by the stage.
